intro: Centaurea georgica, commonly known as Georgian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow to orange flower heads. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, and it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Centaurea georgica is often found in meadows, rocky areas, and along roadsides.
